Description: Rectangular pumice-stone roughly squared off, with softly rounded edges.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 19
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 70 : "A piece of pumice was found in chamber 19". The Findspot number 19 is written in black on one side.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 70)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.88, p.188, pl.30)
